intro: Restio schoenoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, often forming dense, low-growing clumps. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to withstand coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. The species is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils.
